title: Police dispatcher, 28, is killed after a car smashes into a deer
text:
A police dispatcher has been killed after a deer hit her windshield in Michigan, causing her to veer from the road and crash into a tree.

Erika Ladas, 28, had been driving on North Avenue in Ray Township at around 7.20am on Tuesday when a silver Chevy Captiva traveling in the opposite direction struck a deer.

The animal was thrown into her path and struck the windshield of her white Ford 500, landing in the passenger seat of the car, police said in a statement.

Erika Ladas (pictured) was killed after a deer hit her windshield in Michigan, causing her to veer from the road and crash into a tree

Ladas, who had been a dispatcher at the Macomb County Sheriff's Office since January, then veered from the road and crashed into a tree.

She was rushed to hospital where she later died of her injuries. The driver of the Chevy Captiva, 40, was not harmed in the crash.

Macomb County Sheriff Anthony Wickersham described Ladas as somebody who 'worked diligently in dispatch to provide public safety to citizens in need'.

He said: 'Erika was an asset to the Macomb County Sheriff’s Office in her short time here.

Ladas was rushed to hospital where she later died of her injuries (pictured: the two cars involved)

'She was a part of our law enforcement family. She worked diligently in dispatch to provide public safety to citizens in need. Our condolences are with her family.'

Wickersham added it is unknown whether seat belts were worn at the time but said 'alcohol does not appear to be a factor'.

An investigation by the Macomb County Sheriff’s Office is ongoing.
